intro: Osbeckia tortuosa, commonly known as the zigzag knotweed, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its creeping growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a bluish-gray underside, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Osbeckia tortuosa is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
